# Council of Ministers
## Decree No. 16 of 2025
### Appointing the President of Kuwait University

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 regarding the Civil Service, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. 76 of 2019 regarding Public Universities, as amended by Decree-Law No. 156 of 2024,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada al-Awwal 1399 H, corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD, regarding the Civil Service System, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following

**Article One**

Prof. Dr. Dina Misaed Yousef Al-Milam <orig>أ.د. دينا مساعد يوسف الميلم</orig> is appointed as President of Kuwait University <orig>جامعة الكويت</orig> - at the Excellent Grade - for a term of four years, renewable once.

**Article Two**

The Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research <orig>وزير التعليم العالي والبحث العلمي</orig> shall implement this decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Prime Minister
Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>

Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبد الله محمد الجلال</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace on: 3 Sha'ban 1446 H
Corresponding to: 2 February 2025 AD

## Decree No. 17 of 2025
### Appointing an Ambassador

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 21 of 1962 regarding the Diplomatic and Consular Corps System, and its amending laws,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Foreign Affairs,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following

**Article One**

Mishal Ibrahim Al-Mudhaf <orig>مشعل إبراهيم المضف</orig> is appointed as Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Republic of Malta.

**Article Two**

The Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> shall implement this decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Prime Minister
Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>

Minister of Foreign Affairs
Abdullah Ali Abdullah Al-Yahya <orig>عبد الله علي عبد الله اليحيا</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace on: 3 Sha'ban 1446 H
Corresponding to: 2 February 2025 AD# Decree No. 18 of 2025
## Revoking the Kuwaiti Nationality of Certain Individuals

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And based on the proposal of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following

### Article One
The Kuwaiti nationality shall be revoked from the individuals listed below, and from those who may have acquired it with them by dependency:
1- Abdullah Saad Ahmed Awad Al-Qahtani <orig>عبدالله سعد أحمد عوض القحطاني</orig>.

# Decree No. 19 of 2025
## Revoking the Kuwaiti Nationality of an Individual

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to May 10, 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And upon the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following

### Article One
The Kuwaiti nationality shall be revoked from / Ahmed Mohammed Ahmed Yousef <orig>أحمد محمد أحمد يوسف</orig>, and from those who may have acquired it with him by dependency.

### Article Two
The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior shall implement this decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Prime Minister
Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yousuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>
Issued at Seif Palace on: 3 Sha'ban 1446 AH
Corresponding to: February 2, 2025 AD

## Article Three

**Amir of Kuwait**
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

**Prime Minister**
**Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبدالله الأحمد الصباح</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace on: 4 Sha'ban 1446 H
Corresponding to: 3 February 2025 AD

# Cabinet of Ministers Decision No. 29 of 2025 Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificate from an Individual

**The Cabinet of Ministers**
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Article (21 bis "a") of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And based on the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,

Has decided

## Article One
The Kuwaiti citizenship certificate shall be withdrawn from / Hussein Saleh Awadh Masoud Musfir Rashid Al-Ajmi <orig>حسين صالح عوض مسعود مسفر راشد العجمي</orig>, and Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from any person who may have acquired it from him by dependency.

## Article Two
The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior shall implement this decision, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

**Prime Minister**
**Ahmad Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>**

Issued on: 3 Sha'ban 1446 H
Corresponding to: 2 February 2025 AD

Filed by: Adel Issa Abdulaziz Al-Abduljaleel <orig>عادل عيسى عبدالعزيز العبدالجليل</orig> – on his own behalf and in his capacity as the owner of Caliber for Decoration Contracting.
Against:
1- Al-Takhsees Al-Handasia for General Building Contracting Co. (W.L.L.) <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني (ذ.م.م)</orig>.
2- Mohammed Jassem Abdullah Al-Sane' <orig>محمد جاسم عبد الله صانع</orig> – on his own behalf and in his capacity as the company's manager.
Head of the Bankruptcy Administration

In the name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The Court of First Instance
Bankruptcy Circuit / 3

In the session held publicly in court on Tuesday, 24/12/2024 AD.
Presided over by Mr. Abdullah Ali Al-Harbi <orig>عبدالله علي الحربي</orig>, Court Deputy
With the membership of Mr. Mohammed Abdulrahman Al-Nuwaif <orig>محمد عبدالرحمن النويف</orig>, Court Deputy
With the membership of Mr. Waleed Khalid Al-Rabee' <orig>وليد خالد الربيع</orig>, Court Deputy
And in the presence of Mr. Othman Adel Al-Siddi <orig>عثمان عادل الصدي</orig>, Court Clerk
(The following judgment was issued)
In Case No. (9/2024) Bankruptcy Circuit / 3
Automated No.: 240819660
Filed by: Adel Issa Abdulaziz Al-Abduljaleel <orig>عادل عيسى عبدالعزيز العبدالجليل</orig> – on his own behalf and in his capacity as the owner of Caliber for Decoration Contracting.
Against:
1- Al-Takhsees Al-Handasia for General Building Contracting Co. (W.L.L.) <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني (ذ.م.م)</orig>.
2- Mohammed Jassem Abdullah Al-Sane' <orig>محمد جاسم عبدالله الصانع</orig> – on his own behalf and in his capacity as the company's manager.
### (The Reasons)
After hearing the pleadings and reviewing the legally circulated documents:
* Whereas the facts of the case have already been covered by the decision of the Bankruptcy Administration issued on 18/2/2024, to which the court refers to avoid prolixity and repetition; however, the court summarizes the facts of the case sufficiently to connect the elements of this judgment, in that the decision of the bankruptcy judge dated 22/6/2023 addressed the Bankruptcy Committee to provide an opinion on the request submitted by the creditor, Adel Issa Al-Abduljaleel <orig>عادل عيسى العبدالجليل</orig>, on his own behalf and in his capacity as the owner of Caliber for Decoration Contracting; and whereas the petitioner submitted his request to the Bankruptcy Administration to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures against them, effective from the date they ceased payment, which is the date of the final judgment issued against Al-Takhsees Al-Handasia for General Building Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني ذ.م.م</orig>; and the petitioner had stated in his request that he obtained a judgment in Case No. 6125/2016 Commercial/Plenary/3 dated 13/1/2019, and its appeal No. 1187/2019 Commercial/13 dated 23/2/2021, obligating the respondent company to pay him the principal debt owed by it based on a contracting agreement concluded between them, in the amount of 31,900 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig>, plus legal interest at a rate of 7% from the due date of 15/9/2019 until full payment, for a total amount of 32,645 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> and 875 fils; however, it ceased payment despite enforcement procedures being taken against it; and whereas the bankruptcy judge issued his decision dated 28/1/2024 to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures for Al-Takhsees Al-Handasia for General Building Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني ذ.م.م</orig>, setting 23/2/2021 as the provisional date for cessation of payment, and to publish and announce the decision in the Official Gazette and notify the concerned parties.
* Whereas, during the hearing of the case, both the plaintiff and the defendant were represented by their respective attorneys, and the representative for the defendant submitted, in the session of 29/10/2024, a memorandum of defense concluding with a request to dismiss the case and obligate the plaintiff to pay the expenses and actual attorney's fees, and the representative for the defendant, Al-Takhsees Al-Handasia <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية</orig>, submitted a portfolio of documents dated to the session of 10/9/2024, the most important of which included: various photocopies of payment receipts issued by the plaintiff.
* Whereas the court had decided to reserve the case for judgment to be issued in today's session, 26/11/2024, and then decided to extend the date for rendering the judgment to today's session, in order to complete the review of the documents.
* Whereas, regarding the subject matter of the case and the plaintiff's claims therein, it is established by the text of Article 1 of the Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020, which stipulates that in the application of the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning assigned to each... Financial Deficit: The debtor's assets are insufficient to pay off their debts.
* And Article 2 of the same law stipulates that "The provisions of this law shall apply to: 1- Every natural person who has the status of a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies....".
* And the text in Article 29 thereof states that "The bankruptcy judge shall decide on the request, within ten days from the date of the deadlines set for responding to it by issuing his decision to initiate preventive settlement, restructuring, or bankruptcy declaration procedures, and shall specify in his decision a provisional date for the cessation of payment. If the decision to initiate the procedures does not specify the date on which the debtor ceased payment, the date of issuance of the decision to initiate the procedures shall be considered the provisional date for the cessation of payment. If the decision to initiate the procedures is issued after the death of the debtor or after his retirement from commerce and the date of cessation of payment is not specified, the date of death or
<page_end>33</page_end>

<page_start>34</page_start>
<page_metadata>
{
  "page_title": "Kuwait Today - Issue 1725",

  "page_summary": "This page discusses legal articles and court precedents related to bankruptcy law in Kuwait, detailing the procedures for initiating bankruptcy proceedings, the conditions for declaring a debtor bankrupt, and a specific court ruling on a bankruptcy case."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
Kuwait Today Issue 1725 Seventy-First Year
10
Sunday, 10 Sha'ban 1446 AH - 9 / 2 / 2025 AD
</header>

...and the text of Article 34 stipulates that if the bankruptcy judge decides to accept the initiation of restructuring procedures or the declaration of bankruptcy, they shall, in the same decision, appoint the trustee nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee and whose fees have been assessed in accordance with the provisions of this law.... and the text of Article 49 stipulates that the trustee shall receive their fees, as determined by the appointment decision, and the necessary expenses incurred, from the debtor's known assets for the administration of the bankruptcy. A payment on account of these fees and expenses may be disbursed by a decision of the bankruptcy judge.

- Article 131 of the same law stipulates that "...the bankruptcy judge shall issue their decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payment. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuation."

- Article 132 of the same law stipulates that "in all cases where the bankruptcy judge issues their decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Administration shall refer the file of the request to initiate procedures to the Bankruptcy Court within ten days from the date of the bankruptcy judge's decision to initiate the bankruptcy declaration procedures. A report shall be filed with the case file detailing the procedures undertaken for the request from its submission until the issuance of the decision to initiate procedures, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision."

- It has been established in the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation that anyone who engages in commercial transactions in their own name and takes it as their profession is a merchant, and that any creditor with a due commercial debt has the right to request the declaration of bankruptcy of their merchant debtor if the merchant's business is disrupted and they cease to pay their debt in a manner that indicates a troubled financial position and a severe crisis that shakes the merchant's credit, thereby endangering the rights of their creditors. The determination of whether a person is a merchant or not, and the establishment of the facts constituting the state of cessation of payment that leads to the declaration of the merchant's bankruptcy, are matters within the discretion of the trial court, provided it provides valid reasons for its findings."
(Appeal No. 159 / 1995 Commercial – Session of 30 / 6 / 1996)

- It has also been established, as per the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation, that "the trial court has full authority to examine the evidence and documents submitted to it, to weigh what it finds convincing among them, and to deduce what it considers to be the facts of the case. Its assessment thereof and its determination of its sufficiency for conviction are its sole prerogative, provided that this assessment is sound and does not deviate from what is established in the case file... ".
(Appeals No. 555, 599/2005 Commercial, Session of 10/8/2006)

- Whereas, and guided by the foregoing, the plaintiff's request was for a judgment declaring the defendant bankrupt due to its cessation of payment of the debt owed to the plaintiff. And whereas it is legally established that for a debtor to be declared bankrupt, several conditions must be met, namely: the establishment of their status as a merchant, their cessation of payment of a debt they owe due to a deficit in their financial position, and that their business is not viable for continuation. Upon scrutinizing the case file, the request submitted to the Bankruptcy Administration, and the procedures undertaken, the court finds that these conditions apply to the defendant. It has been proven that the defendant refrained from paying a debt it owes, which is established by a final and enforceable judgment, due to a deficit in its financial position. This resulted in the issuance of a decision by the bankruptcy judge to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures and appoint a trustee for it, in accordance with the aforementioned Article 132. Therefore, the court deems the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Administration and its judge in handling the present request to be valid. Consequently, the plaintiff's request to declare the defendant bankrupt is based on a sound foundation of fact and law, and the court shall rule to declare the defendant bankrupt as will be stated in the operative part of the judgment.

- As for the costs, including attorneys' fees, the court orders the defendant to bear them in accordance with the provisions of Article 119/1 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law, and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law.

(For these reasons)

The Court has ruled: To declare the defendant, Al-Takhsees Al-Handasiya for General Building Contracting W.L.L. <orig>شركة التخصيص الهندسية للمقاولات العامة للمباني ذ.م.م</orig>, bankrupt; to set 23 / 2 / 2021 as the provisional date of cessation of payment; and that the Bankruptcy Administration shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register and publish a summary thereof in the Official Gazette in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard; and to add the costs and the sum of ten dinars for attorneys' fees to be borne by the bankruptcy estate.

Clerk of the Court
Presiding Judge

(The Reasons)

After hearing the pleadings, reviewing the documents, and legal deliberation:
Whereas the facts of the case, the litigants' documents, and their defense have been previously established in the referral decision issued by the bankruptcy judge, to which the court refers to avoid repetition, it summarizes them as necessary. The plaintiff filed a petition to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures against the defendant, on the grounds that it had obtained three judgments against the defendant. The first, in Case No. 15115/2017 Commercial/Plenary/24, the operative part of which ordered the defendant to pay the plaintiff the sum of KWD 1,349,052 (one million, three hundred forty-nine thousand and fifty-two Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). This judgment was amended on appeal in Case Nos. 3858 and 3872/2020 Commercial/20, upholding the appealed judgment regarding the aforementioned amount, in addition to interest at a rate of 7% from the date of the judgment on 1/12/2020 until full payment. The second judgment was issued in Case No. 15602/2017 Commercial/Plenary/32, ordering the defendant to pay the plaintiff the sum of 126,000 (one hundred and twenty-six thousand dinars). The third judgment was issued in Case No. 15583/2017 Commercial/Plenary/10, ordering the defendant to pay the plaintiff the sum of KWD 150,000 (one hundred and fifty thousand dinars). The plaintiff served the aforementioned judgments and opened an execution file for them. However, the defendant, being a merchant, has ceased payment of the debt owed by it, amounting to KWD 1,575,000 (one million, five hundred and seventy-five thousand dinars). Therefore, the plaintiff is entitled to file a petition to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures against it, hence this lawsuit.
Whereas the petition was heard before the bankruptcy judge, and on 11/3/2024, he issued his decision to address the Bankruptcy Committee regarding the present petition to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures, with the committee to provide the administration with its opinion on the matter, along with the nomination of a trustee and an estimation of his fees should his appointment be decided in accordance with the law. In implementation of the bankruptcy judge's decision, the Bankruptcy Committee submitted its report dated 5/12/2024, in which it concluded: "* The financial statements for the year 2019 indicate the company's inability to pay the debt amount; therefore, the Committee recommended accepting the initiation of bankruptcy declaration procedures. * The Committee proposes the appointment of a trustee from the list of auditors licensed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory the debtor's assets and properties and take all necessary precautionary measures. * The trustee's fees were estimated at a total amount of KWD 2,000." After the submission of the Bankruptcy Committee's report, the bankruptcy judge issued his decision on 10/6/2024: (1- To accept the petition to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures filed against Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities <orig>شركة بشكارة لمقاولات وتنظيف المباني والمدن</orig>, and to set the date of the petition's submission, 1/4/2024, as the provisional date for cessation of payment. 2- To appoint the auditor, Falah Awadh Al-Mutairi <orig>فلاح عواض المطيري</orig>, who is registered in the list of auditors licensed by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, as a trustee to inventory the petitioner's assets and properties, prepare an updated financial position, a list of debts, a plan for liquidation and distribution, and to take all necessary precautionary measures for that purpose. The appointed trustee's fees were estimated at a total amount of KWD 3,000.

4- Publishing the decision and announcing it in the Official Gazette and notifying the concerned parties thereof).
On 10/6/2024, the bankruptcy judge also issued his decision to refer the bankruptcy declaration request file, as is, to the Bankruptcy Court along with the report, in preparation for a ruling to declare the bankruptcy of the respondent, Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities, assigning the Bankruptcy Department to determine the circuit and the session for its hearing and to notify the concerned parties thereof.
In implementation of the bankruptcy judge's decision, the file was referred to the present circuit and registered under its current number.
Upon hearing the case as shown in the session minutes, the plaintiff's representative appeared and submitted a notified writ of joinder of a new party, which included joining new opponents, so the litigation is against (First: Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities. Second: Abdulrahman Hamed Hamad Al-Ali <orig>عبدالرحمن حامد حمد العلي</orig> in his personal capacity and as manager and partner in Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities. Third: Falah Awadh Al-Mutairi <orig>فلاح عواض المطيري</orig> - the auditor appointed by the Bankruptcy Department as the bankruptcy trustee for Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities). At its conclusion, he requested a judgment: First: To declare the bankruptcy of the first and second defendants and to set 31/1/2021, the date of the last executive judgment, as the final date of cessation of payment, with all the resulting consequences for them, by following all procedures stipulated in Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 as an effect of the declaration of bankruptcy, and to compel the first and second defendants to pay the expenses and actual attorney's fees, and to include the judgment with expedited enforcement without bond. The third defendant in the writ of joinder appeared in person and requested in the last session a judgment declaring the bankruptcy of the first defendant company.
No one appeared on behalf of the first defendant company despite its legal representative being notified, nor did the second defendant in the writ of joinder appear despite being legally notified.
And whereas the court decided to reserve the case for judgment in today's session.
Whereas the court initially refers to the form of joinder contained in the writ of joinder submitted by the plaintiff's representative, it is established in the jurisprudence of the Court of Cassation that, in accordance with the text of Article (86) of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure, "a party may join in the lawsuit anyone who could have been properly sued therein at the time it was filed, and this shall be done through the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit before the day of the session. It may also take place during the session if the person to be joined is present and agrees to this procedure before the court," which implies that joining a party to the lawsuit before the trial court does not depend on obtaining permission from it to do so (Commercial Appeal No. 92/96, session of 21/12/92).
Since that is the case, and the plaintiff has joined both Abdulrahman Hamed Hamad Al-Ali <orig>عبدالرحمن حامد حمد العلي</orig> in his personal capacity and as manager and partner in Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities, as well as Falah Awadh Al-Mutairi <orig>فلاح عواض المطيري</orig> - the auditor appointed by the Bankruptcy Department as the bankruptcy trustee for Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities, specifically in the lawsuit, who could have been properly sued therein at the time it was filed, by virtue of a legally notified writ, the court therefore rules to accept their joinder in form, and notes this in the reasoning without the need to state it in the operative part of the judgment.
And whereas, regarding the plaintiff's request at the conclusion of the writ of joinder for a judgment declaring the bankruptcy of the second defendant (the joined party), Abdulrahman Hamed Hamad Al-Ali <orig>عبدالرحمن حامد حمد العلي</orig>, in his personal capacity and as manager and partner in Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities, since the plaintiff did not submit a request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the aforementioned joined party in accordance with the Bankruptcy Law, its request for his bankruptcy declaration becomes inadmissible. Therefore, it must be ruled inadmissible for failure to follow the path prescribed by law, and the court so rules in the reasoning without the need to state it in the operative part of the judgment.
And whereas, regarding the substance of the request submitted by the plaintiff against the first defendant (Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities), it is stipulated in Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020 that "In the application of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning indicated next to each of them... Financial Position Deficit: That the debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts..." .
And it is stipulated in Article 2 of the same law that "The provisions of this law shall apply to: 1- Every natural person who has the capacity of a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies and branches of foreign companies, with the exception of joint venture companies. 3-
And it is stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 14 of the same law that (Any creditor with an ordinary debt, or a group of creditors with an ordinary debt of no fewer than three, and where the debtor's indebtedness to the creditor or group of creditors is not less than the amount specified by the Executive Regulations on the date of submitting the request, may apply for restructuring or declaration of bankruptcy if they have previously notified the debtor of the need to pay the due debt and he has not initiated payment within one month from the date of notification. This also applies to creditors whose debts are secured by a mortgage on the debtor's commercial premises or an assignment of right over the cash flows arising from the debtor's assets or business. It also applies to creditors whose debts are secured by a mortgage or lien, provided that the value of the guarantees securing their rights on the date of submitting the request is less than the value of the debtor's indebtedness to the creditor applying individually or the group of creditors applying collectively, by a difference of not less than the amount specified by the Executive Regulations. The opinion of the relevant regulatory authority must be sought before determining the amounts referred to in this article for debtors subject to its supervision). And it is stipulated in the first paragraph of Article 4 of Ministerial Resolution No. 81 of 2021 issuing the Executive Regulations

KD (twenty thousand dinars) or a group of no fewer than three creditors with an ordinary debt of no less than KD 10,000 (ten thousand Kuwaiti dinars) may apply to initiate restructuring or bankruptcy declaration procedures for the debtor for that amount).
It is stipulated in Article 131 of the Bankruptcy Law that (without prejudice to the provisions of this law regarding the application to initiate procedures, as well as the cases specified in the chapter on Preventive Settlement and the chapter on Restructuring, in which the Bankruptcy Judge may issue a decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Judge shall issue his decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payment. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable).
It is stipulated in Article 132 of the same law that (in all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge issues a decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Administration shall refer the file of the application to initiate procedures to the Bankruptcy Court within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's issuance of the decision to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures. A report shall be filed with the case file detailing the procedures undertaken regarding the application from its submission until the issuance of the decision to initiate procedures, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision).
It is stipulated in Article 172 of the same law that (the state of bankruptcy is only established by a judgment declaring bankruptcy). The Bankruptcy Administration must, within ten days from the date of the issuance of the bankruptcy declaration judgment, announce, publish, and disclose its operative part on the Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> if the debtor is listed therein, and instruct the debtor to disclose it on its website and register it as set out in Article 33 of this law. It shall also, within ten days from the date of issuance of that judgment, publish and announce a summary thereof).
It is also stipulated in Article 254 of the same law that (the provisions of this law shall generally apply to the procedures of preventive settlement, restructuring, and bankruptcy declaration submitted concerning corporate debts....).
It is established that the trial court has full authority to ascertain the facts of the case from the core of its papers, documents, and the evidence and presumptions presented. It may deduce from the facts of the case and the conduct of the litigants the presumptions upon which it bases its conviction, provided that its deduction is sound, supported by evidence and grounds that have a firm basis in the case file, and leads to the conclusion it reached. The Court of Cassation may intervene if the conclusion it drew from those facts does not legally align with their implications.
(Commercial Appeal No. 704/2000, session of 11/2/2002)
In view of the foregoing, and as it is established from the case file that the plaintiff filed a bankruptcy declaration petition against the first defendant company due to its cessation of payment of the debt owed to the plaintiff under judgments issued in the latter's favor, and the debt amount exceeds the value specified by the executive regulations of the Bankruptcy Law; and the petition was presented to the Bankruptcy Administration, and after receiving the report of the Bankruptcy Committee, the Bankruptcy Judge issued his decision on 10/6/2024 to initiate bankruptcy declaration procedures for the first defendant company and appointed the auditor, Falah Awad Al-Mutairi <orig>فلاح عوض المطيري</orig>, as its trustee. On the same date, the Bankruptcy Judge also issued his decision to refer the bankruptcy declaration petition file as is to the Bankruptcy Court in accordance with the report, in preparation for a judgment declaring the bankruptcy of the first defendant. Given the above, and as it is established to the court from reviewing the Bankruptcy Committee's report that (the financial statements for the year 2019 indicate the company's inability to pay the debt amount, therefore the Committee recommended accepting the initiation of bankruptcy declaration procedures), and as no representative of the first defendant company appeared before the court despite being legally notified to respond to the lawsuit with any plea or defense, the court concludes from the case file and the aforementioned Bankruptcy Committee report that a deficit has occurred in the financial position of the first defendant company, which has resulted in its cessation of payment and the non-viability of its business. Accordingly, the plaintiff's request to declare the bankruptcy of the first defendant company is based on a sound foundation and must be granted, as will be stated in the operative part.
Regarding the request to include expedited enforcement without bond in the judgment, judgments issued by the Bankruptcy Court in accordance with the Bankruptcy Law are enforceable, and there is no need to state this in the operative part. As for the expenses and actual attorneys' fees, since a bankruptcy lawsuit is a procedural action aimed at securing creditors' rights, it is prudent to charge them to the bankruptcy estate, in accordance with the provisions of Article 119/1 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law and Article 189, paragraph (c) of the Bankruptcy Law.

### (For These Reasons)

### The Court has ruled:
To declare the bankruptcy of the first defendant, Bashkara Company for Contracting and Cleaning of Buildings and Cities <orig>شركة بشكارة لمقاولات وتنظيف المباني والمدن</orig>, and to set 1/4/2024 as the provisional date of cessation of payment. The Bankruptcy Administration shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register, publish a summary thereof in the Official Gazette, and announce it in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and take all necessary legal measures concerning its bankruptcy declaration. The expenses and the sum of one hundred dinars for actual attorneys' fees are to be charged to the bankruptcy estate.

Clerk of the Court
Presiding Judge

**First: Definitions of some terms mentioned in the regulations:**
1- **Premarital Examination:** The examination conducted for individuals wishing to marry to detect the presence of certain genetic and infectious diseases, as will be detailed in the regulations, for the purpose of providing medical counseling on the possibility of transmitting these diseases to the other party or to future children, and to provide options and alternatives for those wishing to marry in order to plan for a healthy family.
2- **Premarital Medical Examination Center:** The center affiliated with the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> where individuals wishing to marry go to undergo the premarital medical examination.

Guided by the foregoing, and as the trustee has requested permission to close the files of Ghazal Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين التكافلي</orig> at the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> due to the absence of actual employees in the company, as well as the absence of a headquarters, which renders the debtor's business discontinued, and since granting the trustee's request serves the interest of the creditors by preserving the debtor's funds, we hereby decide that the trustee is entitled to close the files of Al-Dunya Al-Alamiya for General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الدنيا العالمية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> and Dunya Khazaal for General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة دنيا خزعل للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> at the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> and to take the necessary administrative and legal measures to that effect, with all the consequences that may result therefrom.

**Therefore, we have decided:**
The trustee is entitled to close the files of Al-Dunya Al-Alamiya for General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة الدنيا العالمية للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> and Dunya Khazaal for General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة دنيا خزعل للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> at the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> and to take the necessary administrative and legal measures to that effect, with all the consequences that may result therefrom. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall provide the trustee with a certified copy of this decision, publish it in the Official Gazette, register it in the Commercial Register, and legally notify the concerned parties.

**Bankruptcy Judge**

3- Safe Marriage: If the medical examination for those wishing to marry is conducted in accordance with the provisions of these regulations, and the results of the laboratory tests performed are found to be clear.
4- Unsafe Marriage: If the medical examination for those wishing to marry is conducted in accordance with the provisions of these regulations, and the results of the laboratory tests performed are found to be not clear.
5- Electronic Platform: The digital system that allows those wishing to marry to complete certain requests and procedures for the premarital medical examination through approved official applications such as the Sahel <orig>سهل</orig> or Kuwait Seha <orig>كويت صحة</orig> application.

## Second: Those wishing to marry must undergo medical examinations at the Premarital Medical Examination Center to certify that they are free from the following diseases:

1- Infectious Diseases:
a- Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS) - HIV
b- Hepatitis B
c- Hepatitis C
d- Syphilis
2- Hereditary Blood Disorders
a- Thalassemia
b- Sickle Cell Anemia
3- The Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig> may issue a ministerial decision to add any other diseases as required by the public interest.

## Third: Premarital Medical Examination Procedures:

1- Those wishing to marry shall apply to one of the Premarital Medical Examination Centers after submitting the necessary identification documents, requesting a medical examination for each of them, and filling out and signing the designated form for this purpose by each party, attesting to the accuracy of the information and data provided by each. The application shall be registered at the center with a serial number. These requests can also be completed electronically via the designated platform.
2- If either party declares the presence of any hereditary diseases, they shall be referred to the Genetic Diseases Center after blood samples have been taken from them for the premarital medical examination.
3- Blood samples shall be taken from both parties after verifying their identities. Each shall be given a receipt for a follow-up appointment after at least five working days. The samples shall be sent to the examination laboratories of the competent authority in the Ministry to conduct laboratory medical tests for hereditary blood disorders and infectious diseases in accordance with Clause Second, using confidential numbers determined by agreement between the center and the laboratories.
4- The results shall be sent to the Premarital Medical Examination Center after being approved by the specialized laboratory physician.

## Fourth: Results of the Laboratory Medical Examinations:

1- If the results of the laboratory medical examinations conducted for those wishing to marry are found to be clear for both parties, the Premarital Medical Examination Center shall issue a paper or electronic certificate of completion of the premarital medical examination, which certifies that the marriage is safe, to be submitted to the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> to complete the marriage contract procedures. This certificate shall only be delivered to the concerned party (those wishing to marry) or their agent and shall be recorded with a serial number in the center's records.
2- If the laboratory medical examinations conducted for those wishing to marry are found to be not clear for either party, the specialized physician at the Premarital Medical Examination Center shall provide the necessary medical counseling to both parties. If both parties wishing to marry desire to proceed with the marriage contract despite their knowledge that the marriage is unsafe, they shall sign a declaration of their consent and acknowledgment thereof. The representation by an agent for either party shall not be considered valid in this case. A copy of this pledge shall be given to both parties to be submitted to the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> for the solemnization of the marriage. This declaration shall be attached to the premarital medical examination certificate, which will state that the marriage is unsafe.

## Fifth: General Provisions:

1- A marriage contract may not be concluded, nor may any authority solemnize it, except after conducting the laboratory medical examinations and following the procedures stipulated in these regulations.
2- If the results of the laboratory medical examinations conducted for those wishing to marry are found to be not clear, the consent and acknowledgment of a person who has not reached the age of majority to complete the marriage contract shall not be considered valid, nor shall their guardian have the right to represent them in this declaration.
3- All embassies of the State of Kuwait abroad, as well as the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig>, shall be notified not to attest to the marriage contracts of citizens except after the medical examination has been conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 31 of 2008 and its executive regulations contained in this decision.
4- The identity of those wishing to marry must be proven at all different stages of the premarital medical examination procedures. The original proof of identity must be presented, and copies of proof of identity shall not be considered valid.
5- The validity period of the certificate is six months for the two parties to the marriage, during which the marriage must take place between the same parties (those wishing to marry) who were examined. This validity period shall not apply to the certificate if one of the parties wishing to marry changes, in which case a new medical examination must be conducted.
6- The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> shall form a higher committee to follow up on the technical aspects related to the premarital medical examination program, chaired by the Director of the Social Health Department <orig>مدير إدارة الصحة الاجتماعية</orig>. This committee shall be responsible for developing policies, technical guidelines, and work mechanisms; identifying reference laboratories for conducting confirmatory tests for positive or indeterminate cases in coordination with the boards of the specialized departments; and monitoring the application of regulations and legislation. Reports, work results, and recommendations shall be submitted on a semi-annual basis to the Assistant Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health for Public Health Affairs <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة المساعد لشئون الصحة العامة</orig>, in preparation for their submission to the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Resolution No. P.A.I. (1) of 2025 Regarding the Imposition of an Administrative Penalty

**Acting Director General**
**Having reviewed the following:-**

- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Ministerial Resolution No. (2/2018) issued on 31/1/2018, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (A4-111), issued on 12/11/2024, which states that Najd Factory for Perfumes and Incense <orig>مصنع نجد للعطور والبخور</orig> committed the following violation:
  - The unit is closed.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (493/2024/12) held on 11/12/2024.
- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
- And in the public interest

### It is decided
### (Article One)

To warn Najd Factory for Perfumes and Incense <orig>مصنع نجد للعطور والبخور</orig>.
Located in the Fahaheel area (Crafts Complex) - Block (5) - Unit (G58) - of the necessity to rectify the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (one month). In the event of failure to rectify the violation, more severe measures will be taken in accordance with the applicable rules in this regard.

### (Article Two)

This resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

**Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>**

**Issued on: 28 January 2025 G**

- Ministerial Resolution No. (2/2018) issued on 31/1/2018, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Safety Department No. (B4-7), issued on 30/6/2024, stating that the company/ Al-Marjah Workshop for Repair and Maintenance of Light and Heavy Equipment <orig>ورشة المرجاح لتصليح وصيانة المعدات الخفيفة والثقيلة</orig> committed the following violations:
  - Violation of safety and environmental rules and requirements.
  - Lack of personal protective equipment, tools, and devices.
  - Improper storage / storage of hazardous materials.
  - Lack of a fire license.
  - Lack of fire insurance.
  - Electrical hazards.
- Resolution No. H.A.S. (80) of 2024, issued on 11/9/2024, warning the aforementioned to remove the violation within a maximum period of one (1) month from the date of the resolution's issuance.
- The report from the Industrial Safety Department dated 22/10/2024, stating that the violation still exists.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (493/2024/12) held on 11/12/2024.
- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
- And in the public interest.

It is decided
(Article One)
To close Plot No. (104) <orig>القسيمة رقم (104)</orig> located in the South Amghara <orig>جنوب امغره</orig> area – Block (1), belonging to the company/ Al-Marjah Workshop for Repair and Maintenance of Light and Heavy Equipment <orig>ورشة المرجاح لتصليح وصيانة المعدات الخفيفة والثقيلة</orig>, until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.
(Article Two)
In the event the violation is not removed after the passing of one (1) month from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.
(Article Three)
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.
Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالتكليف</orig>
Issued on: 28 January 2025 AD

# Decision No. (23) of 2025
## Regarding a private marketing license for a collective investment scheme established outside the State of Kuwait, granted to the National Investments Company to market the shares of the Forty-Second Ijara and Finance Fund Company Limited

**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and its Executive Bylaws and their amendments;
- The Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association of the National Investments Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>, and the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, INTERVEST LP, and the marketing manager, the National Investments Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>;
- The request from the National Investments Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> to conduct the private marketing of the shares of the Forty-Second Ijara and Finance Fund Company Limited;
- And based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Has decided the following:**
### Article One
The National Investments Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 16,000,000 shares (only sixteen million shares) of the Forty-Second Ijara and Finance Fund Company Limited within the State of Kuwait, which is established in the Cayman Islands. The offer price shall be 10 US Dollars (only ten US Dollars) per share, in addition to a subscription fee of up to 2.25% payable once upon subscription.

### Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Bylaws of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and the Regulation of Securities Activities and their amendments. The entities receiving subscription applications shall be:
- National Investments Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>.
- National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig>.

### Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

### Article Four
The duration of the marketing license is one year, renewable annually, starting from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

### Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

### Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

**Acting Head of the Supervision Sector <orig>رئيس قطاع الإشراف بالإنابة</orig>**
**Fahad Abdullah Al-Fadhli <orig>فهد عبد الله الفضلي</orig>**

Issued on: 3 February 2025 AD

Has decided the following:
### Article One
A license is granted to the National Investments Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> for the private marketing within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> of 75,000 shares (only seventy-five thousand shares) of the Value-Add Fund 1A IC Limited, established in Guernsey. The offer price shall be 1,000 Euros (only one thousand Euros) per share, in addition to a subscription fee of up to 2.25% payable once upon subscription.

### Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to Professional Clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Bylaws of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its amendments. The entities receiving subscription applications shall be:
- National Investments Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>.
- National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig>.

### Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on the information provided in the prospectus.

### Article Four
The term of the marketing license is one year, renewable annually, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

### Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

### Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Acting Head of the Supervision Sector

Issued on: February 6, 2025 G

# Decision No. (29) of 2025
## Regarding a Private Marketing License for a Collective Investment Scheme Established Outside the State of Kuwait, Granted to Watani Investment Company to Market Shares of VALUE-ADD GBP 2A IC LIMITED

After reviewing:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and its Executive Regulations and their amendments;
- The Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association of Watani Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> and the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, GWM IM LIMITED, and the marketing manager, Watani Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>;
- The request from Watani Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> to conduct the private marketing of shares of VALUE-ADD GBP 2A IC LIMITED;
- And based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

### The following has been decided:
### Article One
Watani Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 50,000 shares (only fifty thousand shares) of VALUE-ADD GBP 2A IC LIMITED within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, a company established in Guernsey. The offer price shall be 1,000 Pound Sterling (only one thousand Pound Sterling) per share, in addition to a subscription fee of up to 2.25% payable once upon subscription.

### Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to professional clients only, as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities and their amendments. The entities receiving subscription applications are:
- Watani Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>.
- National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig>.

### Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme are determined based on the information provided in the prospectus.

### Article Four
The term of the marketing license is one year, renewable annually, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

### Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In the event of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

### Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Acting Head of the Supervision Sector

Issued on: February 6, 2025

The Board of Directors has decided to approve the increase of the bank's issued and paid-up capital for the purpose of issuing bonus shares <orig>أسهم المنحة</orig>, and to amend Article Five of both the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> of the bank accordingly:

For the purpose of providing and distributing bonus shares <orig>أسهم المنحة</orig> to shareholders as set out in the agenda of the Ordinary General Assembly meeting scheduled to be held on Saturday, March 15, 2025, the Board has decided and approved to increase the bank's issued and paid-up capital – within the limits of the authorized capital – from an amount of KWD 832,644,290/100 (eight hundred thirty-two million, six hundred forty-four thousand, two hundred ninety Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> and one hundred fils <orig>فلس</orig>) to become an issued and paid-up capital of KWD 874,276,504/600 (eight hundred seventy-four million, two hundred seventy-six thousand, five hundred four Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> and six hundred fils <orig>فلس</orig>). Thus, the amount of the capital increase is KWD 41,632,214/500 (forty-one million, six hundred thirty-two thousand, two hundred fourteen Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> and five hundred fils <orig>فلس</orig>) ("the Capital Increase Amount"). This will be achieved by issuing 416,322,145 new shares (four hundred sixteen million, three hundred twenty-two thousand, one hundred forty-five shares), representing 5% of the issued and paid-up capital, to be distributed as free bonus shares to the shareholders registered in the bank's records as of the entitlement date set for Wednesday, April 9, 2025, at a rate of (5) five shares for every one hundred shares. This increase will be covered from the profit and loss account. # Announcement
The owners of / Fitness General Trading Company <orig>شركة / فايتنس للتجارة العامة</orig> have submitted an application to the Ministry's Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> to amend the legal entity from: Single Person Company to the new legal entity: Limited Liability Company.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of this announcement's publication, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners, in the case of a general or simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor, until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

## Announcement of a Criminal Judgment
The Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>, in its session held on 08-08-2023, in case No. 23/000431 - Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> Criminal Traffic Orders, Police Station No. (23/0000017 - Abdullah Al-Salem <orig>عبدالله السالم</orig>), Automated Case No. 232173860, issued a judgment in absentia against the accused: Hassan Eid Saleh <orig>حسن عيد صالح</orig>, Nationality: United Kingdom, Civil ID No.:, stipulating:
The accused is ordered to pay a fine of forty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> for the charge brought against him. The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> hereby notifies the convicted person of this judgment and directs all security authorities to enforce it in accordance with the provisions of Article 188 of the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig>. It should be noted that if a period of thirty-seven days, calculated from the day after publication, elapses without the convicted person challenging the judgment through opposition or appeal, the judgment will become final and enforceable against him.
Director of the Criminal Enforcement Prosecution <orig>مدير نيابة التنفيذ الجنائي</orig>

Please bring the following documents to obtain the terms and conditions booklet:

4. A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage.

- The final deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the announcement above for the deposit of bids.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions for submitting and depositing bids on CD, which are available on the Authority's website: WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid by a certified check or K-Net card.
- Companies/bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must submit them to the concerned entity at the time and place specified in the table above for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). Any inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Authority will not be considered.

It should be noted that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid-opening session.
- Companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department before the day scheduled for the bid-opening session and bring the following documents:
1. A copy of the Civil ID.
2. A copy of the signature authorization specific to the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. In the event that someone other than the authorized signatory attends, a written letter from the person whose signature is authorized with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات</orig> must be presented, delegating whomever they see fit to attend the session.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to the Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the tender must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is an integral part of the tender documents.
- For more information, please visit our website at WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.

# Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>

## Announcement

Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. (37-2024/2025) for the maintenance of 72 Electroclass brand electric file storage cabinets for the Bank's branches (Capital <orig>العاصمة</orig>, Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقة</orig>, Al-Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig>, Gharnata <orig>غرناطة</orig>). Interested parties wishing to submit their bids should visit the Bank to purchase the booklet of terms and technical specifications for the aforementioned tender, according to the details specified below:

<table_caption>Kuwait Credit Bank Tender Information</table_caption>
<table>
| | |
|:---|:---|
| **Location** | Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> - Main building located in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> – Ministries Area – Plot 1, Block 900023, Telephone No.: 1810000, Sixth Floor. |
| **Visiting Hours** | From (8:30) AM until (01:00) PM. |
| **Fee for Purchasing the Booklet** | (75 K.D.) Seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only – non-refundable. |
</table>

### Required Documents
1. An authorization letter for the person present to purchase the booklet of general and special conditions for this tender, along with a copy of their civil ID, certified by the authorized signatory of the company. A letter of signature authorization for the company's signatory, certified by the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>لجنة المناقصات المركزية</orig>, must also be provided.
2. Contact number for any inquiries related to the Purchasing Committee of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.
3. A recent and up-to-date copy of the certificate of registration with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
4. A recent copy of the tender announcement.
5. A recent and up-to-date copy of the renewed national labor percentage certificate issued by the competent authority.
6. A recent and up-to-date copy of the company's commercial registration certificate.
7. A recent and up-to-date copy of the certificate of registration with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
A valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there are no holds on the tenderer's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. (6) of 2010 regarding work in the private sector.
7. A copy of the company's registration form in the institution's register of suppliers, contractors, and undertakers.

### Conditions of the Submitted Bid
- The bidder must submit a technical offer and a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, ensuring a copy of the bid is attached on a flash memory drive, in accordance with the following conditions:
- The technical envelope must contain the following:
  - An initial guarantee in the form of a letter of guarantee for the amount of (2,000 K.D.) "only two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>", which is unconditional, free of any reservations, and irrevocable, issued by an approved bank in the State of Kuwait in the bidder's name and for the benefit of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. This guarantee must be valid for at least three months from the deadline for receiving bids. Any bid not accompanied by this full guarantee will be excluded. Initial guarantees may not be returned until after the passage of (90) ninety days from the tender closing date or when the winning tenderer submits the final guarantee and signs the contract, unless the tender is canceled. Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this guarantee, and the tenderer's creditors may not seize its amount.
  - The general and special conditions and technical data of the submitted offer.
  - Full details of any Kuwaiti subcontractors, whether companies or individuals, to whom part of the execution may be assigned, if required by the tender documents.
  - Any other documents or data that may be required by the tender documents.
- The financial envelope must contain the following:
  - The bid form, certified by the bidder.
  - Price lists and bills of quantities.
  - Any other elements that may affect the financial value of the offer as stipulated by the tender conditions.
  - Any other documents or data required by the tender documents.
- The Bank has the right to cancel the tender without stating the reasons.
- All documents must be valid.
- Bid envelopes must be securely sealed with red wax.

<table_caption>Kuwait Credit Bank Tender Schedule and Notes</table_caption>
<table>
| | |
|:---|:---|
| **Preliminary Meeting Date** | Inquiries will be received via email on 16/2/2025 and 17/2/2025 at methker@KCB.GOV.KW and A.Almojil@kcb.gov.kw |
| **Deadline for Receiving Bids** | Bids in a sealed envelope must be addressed to the Director General <orig>مدير عام</orig> of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> and deposited in the Purchasing Committee's box at the Financial Department of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> no later than 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 04/03/2025. |
| **Note** | It is important to review the circulars related to the tenders of the Purchasing Committee of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, available on the Bank's official website under the section titled "General and Special Circulars on Procurement Systems for Public Entities". |
</table>

# Kuwait Foreign Petroleum Exploration Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للاستكشافات البترولية الخارجية</orig>
## Announcement
### To Enter a Public and Non-Divisible Tender No. (281-12-24)
The Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries, upon the request of the Kuwait Foreign Petroleum Exploration Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للاستكشافات البترولية الخارجية</orig> (KUFPEC), announces Tender No. (281-12-24) concerning the Microsoft Enterprise Agreement for the main building of the Kuwait Foreign Petroleum Exploration Company in the Shuwaikh Administrative Area.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Fees</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender Issue Date | Pre-Tender Meeting Date | Closing Date | Document Purchase Fee | Initial Deposit |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| 9/2/2025 | 18/2/2025 | 11/3/2025 | 500.000 Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> | 15,000.000 Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> |
</table>

1. This is a public and non-divisible tender. All participating companies must provide authorization from Microsoft to conduct EA agreements in Kuwait, in addition to providing authorization from Microsoft to conclude Enterprise Agreements in Kuwait.

# Aresco Security Company (K.S.C.C.) for the year 2025/1
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Aresco Security Company (K.S.C.C.) was held on Thursday, January 16, 2025, at 2:00 PM at the company's headquarters in the Al-Wataniya Commercial Complex - 4th Floor, Office 423. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Tariq Sulaiman Saud Al-Mudhaf <orig>طارق سليمان سعود المضف</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, and was attended by:

<table_caption>Meeting Attendees</table_caption>
<table>
| | |

the attendees, thanking them for accepting the invitation to attend, and then began discussing the agenda of the Ordinary General Assembly as follows:
Approval of the amendment of Article (13) of the Articles of Association to reduce the number of company board members from five members to three members.

- **Article Before Amendment:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> composed of five members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable. The shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors at the specified time, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons preventing it cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.
Every shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors, except to the extent that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as the elected members. The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

- **Article After Amendment:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> composed of three members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable. The shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors at the specified time, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's business until the reasons preventing it cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.
Every shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors, except to the extent that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as the elected members. The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

After reviewing the applications submitted to amend data in the births and deaths records, it was decided to list the amendments below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of this announcement's publication, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting, Session No. 02/2025, held on 14/01/2025

The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, has convened.

| | |
| :--- | :--- |
| Mr. / Director of the Central Registry of Births and Deaths Department | Chairman |
| Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council | Member |
| Ms. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Registration Section | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section | Member |
| Mr. / The Legal Researcher | Member |
| Mr. / Head of the Records Section | Member |

The secretarial duties of the committee were performed by Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig>.

The Committee reviewed applications from No. ((18)) to No. ((30)) in the attached list, concerning the amendment of data in the births and deaths records for requests of unrecorded births and deaths. After examination and verification of the completion of documents and records, the Committee decides to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement elapses without any objection being submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and the birth and death certificates will be issued.

# Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting No. 03/2025, held on 21/01/2025

After reviewing the applications submitted to amend data in the birth and death records, it was decided to make the amendments listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of this announcement's publication, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee meeting, session No. 03/2025, held on 21/01/2025

The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, has convened.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerks Department of the Court of First Instance announces the sale by public auction of the property described below on Thursday, 6/3/2025, in Hall 52, on the second floor of the Justice Palace at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court ruling issued in Case No. 2023/105 Sales/3.

Filed by: Mona Mousa Ibrahim Al-Balooshi <orig>منى موسى إبراهيم البلوشي</orig>.

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- The property under Document No. 2022/8011, located in Al-Dhaher <orig>الظهر</orig> – Plot 390 <orig>قسيمة 390</orig> – Block No. 5 <orig>قطعة رقم 5</orig> – from Plan No. M/36923 – with an area of 278.92 m².
** Note: There is an unlicensed building violation on the second floor with an area of 80 m².
* Inspection:
On 10/5/2022, we proceeded to the Al-Dhaher <orig>الظهر</orig> area – Block 5 – Street 1 – Plot 390 – House 21 – with an area of 278.92 m² – PACI No. 13943606. This was conducted in the presence and under the guidance of the first defendant in person, the plaintiff's agent, and in the presence of the technical expert from the department, Mr. Adel Al-Aslawi <orig>عادل العسلاوي</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The first defendant requested the plaintiff's husband to wait outside until the inspection was completed due to the presence of women in the house.
2- The property in dispute is a government-provided residence located on two streets (front and back), bordered by neighbors on two sides, and is clad in white lime plaster. It consists of a ground floor, a first floor, a roof, a yard, and an internal car park.
3- The property has 3 entrances: 2 from the main service road and one from the back street. It has a large setback overlooking the Al-Dhaher <orig>الظهر</orig> clinic.
4- The ground floor consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom, which has an external door leading to the yard and another to the house; a living room; two separate rooms serving as a lounge and a servant's room with a bathroom; a main kitchen; and 2 storage rooms. It was found that one of the rooms and its adjacent storage room are additions to the original government construction.
5- The first floor consists of a master bedroom containing a dressing room and a private bathroom, occupied by the first defendant; 4 bedrooms; a living room; and 2 shared external bathrooms, occupied by the first, second, sixth, and eighth defendants.
6- The first defendant stated that he, his wife, and his son have been the actual possessors of the property since 10/2018, following the death of their legator, in addition to the second, sixth, and eighth defendants, who have been there since the government house was received.
7- The first defendant also stated that the plaintiff occupied the property until 1/2020, as she used to stay in the house on days when her husband was traveling and was not prevented from entering the house.
8- The roof consists of a stairwell and a large area covered with corrugated sheets, used as a storage space.
9- The house's air conditioning consists of window and split units. The flooring is ceramic, and the storage room floors are tiled.
10- The technical expert inspected the property in preparation for appraising its value.

Second: Auction Conditions:
