To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their expense during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who is willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one else comes forward

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- The property of Document No. 2012/9235 located in the Al-Manqaf <orig>المنقف</orig> area – Plot 12 – Block 52 – from Plan No. M/30161 – with an area of 1050 m².

** Note:
1- There are several violations – the utility connection was moved from the service road side to the square.
2- Partitions were installed in the basement, and a structure was built on the ground floor as an entrance to the basement, which is used as a health club with an area of 5 m² A+B.
3- A portion of the hallway on the second floor was annexed to the studio.

*Inspection:
On 5/9/2024, we proceeded to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit, located in the Al-Manqaf <orig>المنقف</orig> area, Block 52, Plot 12, with an area of 1050 m² from Plan No. M/30161, registered under No. 2012/9235 according to the document. Under the guidance of the plaintiff's agent, the first defendant's agent, and the second defendant's agent, and according to the Kuwait Finder <orig>كويت فايندر</orig> program, it was found that the current address of the disputed property is Al-Manqaf <orig>المنقف</orig> area, Block 1, Street 134, Plot 5212, and it has the automated number 93119798. The inspection was conducted in the presence of the representative of Access Kuwait General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أكسس الكويت للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> (the property's tenant – not a party to the lawsuit) and the Administration's expert appraiser, Mr. Adel Fahad Maatouq Al-Aslawi <orig>عادل فهد معتوق العسلاوي</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property is an investment building (apartment building) consisting of a basement + ground floor + nine (9) recurring floors + a roof. It is clad in beige Jordanian stone, has central air conditioning, two (2) elevators, and two (2) staircases. The exterior openings are aluminum and glass. The building has front and back facades with side access, as it is located on an internal street (No. 134) and a rear square.
- The representative of Access Kuwait General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أكسس الكويت للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> provided guidance on the components of the disputed property as follows:
1. The basement is an open space + services, fully leased by the health club.
2. The ground floor consists of two (2) shops on the rear square side. The first is a health institute named Atlas Chain Health Institute, and the second is a car rental shop named Princess, as shown on their advertising signs. There is also a management office + a glass-enclosed rest area + a guard's room consisting of (a room + bathroom + kitchen) + an apartment consisting of two rooms, a living room, and a bathroom + a side annex covered by a canopy belonging to the health club. The rest of the ground floor is closed.
3. The recurring floors from the first to the ninth consist of: each floor has five (5) apartments. Four (4) apartments consist of two (2) rooms + two (2) bathrooms + a living room + a kitchen, and one (1) apartment consists of a bedroom + a living room + a bathroom + a kitchen.
4. The roof floor consists of: an elevator room + a stairwell.
The Administration's expert appraiser recorded the observations in preparation for estimating the value of the property (land and building) and the revenue of the property subject of the lawsuit. The first defendant's agent stated that the entire building is occupied and leased by Access Kuwait General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أكسس الكويت للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>, and the first defendant receives an amount of KWD 6,000 (only six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) per month for the rents. The representative of Access Kuwait General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أكسس الكويت للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> stated that they sublet the property to others for KWD 2,500 (only two thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) per month for the health club and KWD 1,500 (only one thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) per month for the car rental shop, and the apartment rents range from KWD 170 to KWD 210 per month.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the base price of KWD 1,980,000 (one million, nine hundred and eighty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price is required by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time the sale session is held.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be reopened at his own risk during the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless another person comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with an increase of one-tenth, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the one-tenth increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at his own risk based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the execution procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and under their responsibility, without the Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the official gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for the market rent."

President of the Court of First Instance

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Announcement of Sale by Sealed Bid Auction
Auction No. (2445)
The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of various air conditioning units, compressors, a pile of iron, electrical appliances, a pile of wires, and spotlights by sealed bid auction at the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>, according to the following details: –
1. Location for receiving the terms and conditions booklet and participation offer for the auction: At the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig> – formerly the Ministry of Planning <orig>وزارة التخطيط</orig> – Arabian Gulf Street <orig>شارع الخليج العربي</orig> – Cash Flow Section, from 09/02/2025 until 13/02/2025. The documents will be handed over for a non-refundable fee of (20) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> to be paid at the cashier of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development. The bidder will sign an acknowledgment and pledge upon receiving the terms and conditions booklet to adhere to the specified date for submitting the offer to the Central Sales Committee at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>.
2. Inspection Date: (5) working days from 09/02/2025 until 13/02/2025. Inspection Time: During official working hours.
3. Location for receiving those wishing to inspect the auction items: General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>.
4. Date for submitting offers and opening envelopes:
   - Submission of offers on Sunday, 16/02/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department – Central Sales Section, according to the time specified for the bidder by the Ministry of Health (and no offer will be accepted after the specified time for the bidder has passed).
   - Opening of envelopes and holding the auction on Monday, 17/02/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department.
   - The winning bidder will be announced on the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> website on Monday, 17/02/2025.
   - Checks will be returned to unsuccessful bidders on Tuesday, 18/02/2025.
   - The certified check / bank guarantee shall be submitted in the name of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>.
- **Special Conditions for the Auction:**
  1. The bidder must be a Kuwaiti citizen – individual or company – registered in the Commercial Register and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>. A foreigner may participate provided they have a Kuwaiti partner or agent who is a merchant under a notarized contract. (Must attach: a copy of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate, a copy of the company license, a copy of the Civil ID, and an authorization letter certified by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, all of which must be valid).
  2. Kuwaiti individuals are allowed to participate in the auction (a copy of the Civil ID must be attached). To receive the auction's terms and conditions booklet: Please contact Mr. Mohammed Al-Arbash <orig>محمد الأربش</orig>, Phone:

# National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters (NCCAL) <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>

## Announcement

The National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters (NCCAL) <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig> announces Tender No. N.C.C.A.L. – 6(2024/2025) for the investment and operation of a bakery in Al-Ahmadi Market <orig>سوق الاحمدي</orig>. Specialized companies wishing to participate in this tender may obtain the tender documents for a non-refundable fee of (20 K.D.), only twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> – Contracts Section <orig>قسم العقود</orig> – Second Floor – National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters building, Al-Shuhada Street – Sharq <orig>شارع الشهداء – الشرق</orig>.
The deadline for submitting bids is within (30 days from the date of this announcement).
All documents must be submitted on (CD) in 3 copies, with the exception of (the bid form, the initial deposit, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the bidder information form).
*The tender is indivisible, and alternative bids will not be accepted.
*This announcement serves as an invitation for bidders wishing to attend the envelope-opening session, following coordination with the Purchases Supervision <orig>مراقبة المشتريات</orig> prior to the day scheduled for the bid-opening session.
*A preliminary meeting will be held to answer bidders' inquiries after (12 days from the date of this announcement) at 11:30 AM in the meeting hall at Al-Qiblia School <orig>المدرسة القبلية</orig>.

---

## Announcement

Regarding Practice No. N.C.C.A.L. – (9) /2024/2025 for the Maintenance of Electrical Networks and their Systems in the buildings of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters (NCCAL) <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig>
Specialized companies registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders (CAPT) <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> wishing to participate in this practice may obtain the practice documents for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> – Contracts Section <orig>قسم العقود</orig> – Second Floor – Room (1), National Council building, Al-Shuhada Street – Sharq <orig>شارع الشهداء – الشرق</orig>, within (7 working days) from the date of this announcement's publication in the official gazette, Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>.
A preliminary meeting will be held to answer participants' inquiries on Tuesday of the first week following the announcement's publication in the gazette, at Al-Qiblia School <orig>المدرسة القبلية</orig>, Architectural and Engineering Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المعمارية والهندسية</orig>, at 10:00 AM sharp. A copy of the practice purchase receipt must be brought.

Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1725 Seventy-first Year Sunday, 10 Sha'ban 1446 AH - February 9, 2025 AD 138

This is in exchange for an amount of KWD 75 (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), in the form of a non-refundable certified check issued by a bank licensed to operate in the State of Kuwait in favor of the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig>, or through the K-Net service. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees (upon presentation of the relevant certificate).

Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 2:00 PM on Thursday, February 9, 2025.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Fees</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender | Preliminary Meeting | Closing | Document Price | Guarantee |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 2025/2/9 | 2025/2/19 | 2025/3/6 | KWD 75/- | 2% of the bid value, valid for 90 days |
</table>

It should be noted that this tender is open to local companies and establishments registered and classified with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> who meet the legal conditions and requirements that qualify them to enter this tender and submit their offers.

- The tender is indivisible.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copiable CD, except for the bid form and the initial guarantee, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications must do so during the preliminary meeting for all bidders, scheduled to be held on Wednesday, February 19, 2025, at 10:00 AM at the headquarters of the Kuwait Authority for Partnership Projects <orig>هيئة مشروعات الشراكة بين القطاعين العام والخاص</orig> – Touristic Enterprises Company building – Second Floor – Shuwaikh Administrative Area, or at any other location specified by the Authority. Whether the bidder attends this meeting or not, they shall be bound by the decisions and recommendations made therein. No inquiries or clarifications will be considered, and no claim made in this regard will be recognized, either before or after the signing of the contract document.
- This announcement is an integral, complementary, and supplementary part of the tender documents.
- The Authority reserves the full right to reject all submitted offers, amend the tender documents whenever it deems necessary, or cancel the tender without stating the reasons.

- A valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted, stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. (6) of 2010 regarding work in the private sector. - The bidder must attach a certificate of payment of contributions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article (95) of the Social Security Law.
- Compliance with these procedures is in application of the provisions of Law No. 49 of 2016 regarding Public Tenders, as amended by Law No. 74 of 2019, its executive regulations issued by Decree No. 30 of 2017, and the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> Circular No. 5 of 2020 regarding procurement systems for public entities.

Pursuant to the text of Article (29) of Law No. (49) of 2016 regarding Public Tenders, "A single person or a group of persons collectively may not register for classification under more than one name, nor submit more than one bid in a tender, with the exception of alternative bids where the tender conditions permit their submission. # Petrochemical Industries Company

## Announcement

The Higher Procurement Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation and its Oil Companies (H.P.C), based on the request of the Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> – Internal Procurement Committee (I.P.C) <orig>لجنة الشراء الداخلية</orig>, announces the issuance of Tender No.: MNA/34/2024 regarding the Supply of Mobile Equipment.

<table_caption>Tender Details for PIC Tender MNA/34/2024</table_caption>
<table>
| Issue Date | Closing Date | Document Fee | Initial Guarantee |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 09/02/2025 | 11/03/2025 | KWD 100 | KWD 2,500/- |
</table>

This tender is limited and non-divisible, restricted to the companies listed in the table below.

### Brief on the Tender Works:
Supply of mobile equipment to PIC on rental basis (Daily/Monthly) along with or without operators, which includes of transportation, fuel, Maintenance of the supplied equipment, rigging, Mobilization & demobilization of the equipment and manpower.

The closing date for the tender is at 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 11/03/2025. The bid must be sent to the email address of the Subcommittee for Opening Bid Envelopes – ipc
sc@pic.com.kw. No copy of the bid should be sent to any other entity except the aforementioned email, otherwise the bid will be considered void. The bid validity period shall be (90) days from the date of opening the bid envelopes. No bid will be accepted after the specified day.
